subtopic: A/B testing and false discovery rate
main_point: The professor explains A/B testing and false discovery rate and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes dataset shift (a process) from bootstrap (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving variance and false discovery rate.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a student misconception to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for p-value shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
